alert.note: Alert for Columbia; Lincoln; McDuffie (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued January 12 at 5:56PM EST until January 12 at 6:45PM EST by NWS Columbia
info.description: The National Weather Service in Columbia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... McDuffie County in east central Georgia... Columbia County in east central Georgia... Lincoln County in east central Georgia... Western Edgefield County in central South Carolina... Western Aiken County in central South Carolina... Western Saluda County in central South Carolina... McCormick County in central South Carolina... * Until 645 PM EST. * At 556 PM EST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Nancy Hart State Park to 7 miles southeast of Sparta, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. * Locations impacted include... North Augusta, Grovetown, Evans, Thomson, Martinez, McCormick, Harlem, Lincolnton, Appling, Clarks Hill Recreation Area, Elijah Clark State Park, Riverwood, Mistletoe State Park, Wrightsboro, Hamilton Branch State Park, J. Strom Thurmond Dam, Mccormick County Airport, Thomson-McDuffie County Airport, Dearing and Parksville. This includes Interstate 20 in Georgia between mile markers 166 and 194. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EST for east central Georgia...and central South Carolina. For your protection seek shelter inside a sturdy building and stay away from windows. Persons in campgrounds should seek shelter until these storms pass. Severe thunderstorms can produce large capsizing waves and frequent lightning. If on or near Lake Strom Thurmond move away from the water and take shelter! A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EST for east central Georgia...and central South Carolina.
